tuv.seg: • After the order is made
• Tar éis ordú a dhéanamh
If you owe money to someone else, then you are a debtor and the other person is a creditor
Is féichiúnaí tú má tá airgead ag duine éigin ort agus is creidiúnaí an duine (nó and comhlacht) a bhfuil airgead aige ort
If you fail to pay a debt, your creditor can go to court to get a judgment that you owe the debt
Muna íocann tú fiach, is féidir leis an gcreidiúnaí dul go dtí an chúirt chun breithiúnas a fháil i do choinne
Getting a judgment means that the creditor is now entitled to use various mechanisms to get the money from you
Is éard is brí le breithiúnas a fháil ná go bhfuil an creidiúnaí i dteideal anois úsáid a bhaint as meicníochtaí éagsúla chun an t-airgead a fháil uait
This is known as enforcing a judgment – the legal term is execution of the judgment
Tugtar breithiúnas a fhorfheidhmiú air seo – is é an téarma dlíthiúil ná forghníomhú an bhreithiúnais
There are several different ways of enforcing a judgment
Tá roinnt bealaí éagsúla chun breithiúnas a fhorfheidhmiú
The creditor chooses the means and can use several different means at the same time
Roghnaíonn an creidiúnaí na modhanna agus is féidir leis modhanna éagsúla a úsáid ag an am céanna
The Civil Debt (Procedures) Act 2015 provides for changes in how debts can be enforced
Athróidh an t Acht um Fhiachas Sibhialta (Nósanna Imeachta), 2015 an tAcht 2015 na cleachtais maidir le forfheidhmiú fhiachas sibhialta
It is due to come into effect shortly
Tá sé le teacht i bhfeidhm go luath
After the order is made
Tar éis ordú a dhéanamh
In general, once the creditor has a judgment order, the judgment can be enforced
Go ginearálta, nuair atá ordú breithiúnais ag an gcreidiúnaí, is féidir an breithiúnas a chur i bhfeidhm
Enforcement orders can be issued by court offices – the creditor does not have to go back to court for the order
Is féidir orduithe forfheidhmithe a bheith eisithe ag oifigí cúirte – ní chaithfidh an creidiúnaí dul ar ais chun na cúirte le haghaidh an ordaithe
Creditors have 12 years from the date of the judgment to look for enforcement orders
Tá 12 bliain ag creidiúnaithe ó dháta an bhreithiúnais chun orduithe forghníomhaithe a lorg
However, if the judgment order was issued 6 or more years earlier, the creditor may have to apply to court for leave to issue execution

Mar sin féin, má dheonaíodh an t-ordú breithiúnais sé nó níos mó de bhlianta roimhe sin, seans go mbeidh ar an gcreidiúnaí iarratas a dhéanamh ar an gcúirt le 'cead chun forghníomhú a eisiúint' a fháil
Once issued, enforcement orders are generally valid for a year and may then be renewed
Nuair a eisítear iad, tá orduithe forghníomhaithe bailí, go ginearálta, ar feadh bliana agus féadfar athnuachán a dhéanamh orthu ansin
The courts can grant a stay of execution
Is féidir leis na cúirteanna bac ar fhorghníomhú a bhronnadh
This means that the enforcement of the debt is halted for a period
Is éard is brí leis seo ná go gcuirtear stop le forfheidhmiú an fhéich ar feadh tréimhse
A stay of execution may be granted, for example, if you can show that your inability to pay is not your fault
Is féidir bac ar fhorghníomhú a bhronnadh más féidir leat a thaispeáint nach bhfuil locht d’éagumais íocaíochta ort, mar shampla
You cannot get a stay of execution if you have not engaged with the proceedings
Ní féidir leat bac ar fhorghníomhú a fháil mura bhfuil tú ag gabháil leis na himeachtaí
This involves the creditor registering the judgment in the Central Office of the High Court
Cuimsíonn sé seo an creidiúnaí ag clárú an bhreithiúnais i bPríomh-Oifig na hArd-Chúirte
Judgments from the District Court, the Circuit Court and the High Court may all be registered
Is féidir le breithiúnais ón gCúirt Dúiche, ón gCúirt Chuarda agus ón Ard-Chúirt ar fad a bheith cláirithe
Registering the judgment does not directly enforce the judgment
Ní chuireann clárú an bhreithiúnais an breithiúnas i bhfeidhm ar bhealach díreach
It does, however, publicise the fact that there is a judgment against you and, as a result, means that you are unlikely to be able to borrow further
Poiblíonn sé, áfach, go bhfuil breithiúnas i do choinne agus, mar thoradh air sin, ciallaíonn sé nach dócha go bhfuil tú le bheith in ann tuilleadh a fháil ar iasacht
Lists of judgments are published by credit reference agencies (for example, in Stubbs Gazette and some newspapers)
Tá liostaí na mbreithiúnas foilsithe ag gníomhaireachtaí teistiméireachta creidmheasa (mar shampla, i Stubbs Gazette agus roinnt nuachtáin)
Before registering a judgment, the creditor must tell you that it is intended to register and give you an opportunity to pay the debt
Roimh bhreithiúnas a chlárú, ní mór don chreidiúnaí a insint duit go bhfuil sé i gceist é a chlárú agus deis a thabhairt duit an fiacha íoc
The following are the main ways of enforcing judgments:
Seo a leanas na príomhbhealaí breithiúnais a fhorfheidhmiú:
• Instalment orders, followed (if necessary) by committal orders
• Orduithe tráthchoda, leanta (más gá) ag orduithe cimithe
• Judgment mortgage (see more in our document on home repossession)
• Morgáiste breithiúnais (féach ar ár gcáipéis ar athshealbhú baile)
Other ways of enforcing judgments include attachment of debts, appointment of a receiver and bankruptcy proceedings, but these are rarely used for consumer debts
Bealaí eile ata ar fáil ná astú fiacha, glacadóir a cheapadh nó imeachtaí féimheachta, ach is annamh a úsáidtear iad seo i leith fiacha tomhaltóirí
They are briefly outlined in ‘Other methods of enforcing judgments’ below
Tá curs síos gairid ar na roghanna seo i 'Bealaí eile forfheidhmithe' thíos
Execution against goods is one of the main ways of enforcing a judgment
Tá forghníomhú in aghaidh earraí ar cheann de na príomhbhealaí chun breithiúnas a fhorfheidhmiú
It is sometimes called distress against goods
Uaireanta tugtar anacair in aghaidh earraí air
It means that the creditor gets an order from the court which directs the Sheriff or County Registrar to seize your goods and sell them in order to raise the amount of money which you owe plus costs

Is éard is brí leis ná go bhfaigheann an creidiúnaí ordú ón gcúirt a ordaíonn an Sirriam nó an Cláraitheoir Contae do chuid earraí a ghabháil agus iad a dhíol chun an méid airgid atá dlite agat a ardú chomh maith le costais
• In the case of a High Court judgment, the order directing the seizure of your goods is known as an order of fieri facias or fifa
• I gcás breithiúnas Ard-Chúirte, tugtar ordú fieri facias nó fifa ar an ordú ag stiúradh urghabháil do chuid earraí
• In the case of a Circuit Court judgment, the order is known as an execution order against goods
• I gcás breithiúnas Cúirte Cuarda, tugtar ordú i gcoinne earraí forghníomhaithe ar an ordú
• In the case of the enforcement of a District Court judgment, the court’s judgment or decree itself is sent to the Sheriff or County Registrar for execution
• I gcás fhorghníomhú bhreithiúnas na Cúirte Dúiche, seoltar breithiúnas na cúirte nó an fhoraithne é féin chuig an Sirriam nó chuig an gCláraitheoir Contae le forghníomhú
Sheriffs and County Registrars
Sirriamaí agus Cláraitheoirí Contae
Sheriffs enforce judgments in counties Cork and Dublin while County Registrars enforce them in all other places
Forfheidhmíonn Sirriamaí breithiúnais i gcontaetha Chorcaí agus Bhaile Átha Cliath agus forfheidhmíonn Cláraitheoirí Contae iad in áiteanna eile
Sheriffs are self-employed people who are paid for their enforcement work on a commission basis
Is daoine féinfhostaithe iad Sirriamaí atá íoctha as a gcuid obair fhorfheidhmithe ar bhonn coimisiúin
The system is called 'poundage'
Is córas é ar a dtugtar 'puntáiste'
The fees that they get are set out in Statutory Instruments
Tá na táillí a fhaigheann siad leagtha amach in ionstraimí reachtúla
The current one is the Sheriff’s Fees and Expenses Order (SI 644/2005) made under the Enforcement of Court Orders Act 1926
Is é Ordú Táillí agus Costais Sirriam (IR644/2005) an ceann reatha, a rinneadh faoin Acht um Fheidhmiú Orduithe Cúirte 1926
This provides for various fixed fees and a scale of fees related to the amount involved
Soláthraíonn sé seo táillí socraithe éagsúla agus scála táillí a bhaineann leis an méid atá i gceist
This is 5% of the first €5,500 and 2.5% of the balance
Is é seo 5% den chéad €5,500 agus 2.5% den iarmhéid
It also provides for the payment of various expenses incurred in the enforcement process
Ina theannta sin, soláthraíonn sé costais éagsúla a íoc a tabhaíodh mar chuid den phróiseas forfheidhmithe
County Registrars are civil servants whose main job is to organise the business of the Circuit Court in their areas
Is státseirbhísigh iad Cláraitheoirí Contae a bhfuil eagrú gnó na Cúirte Cuarda mar phríomhphost acu in a gceantair féin
(They are also Returning Officers for elections and referendums.)
(Is Cinn Chomhairimh iad freisin le haghaidh toghchán agus reifreann.)
As well as County Sheriffs in Cork and Dublin, there are Revenue Sheriffs who enforce debts owed to the Revenue Commissioners
Chomh maith le Sirriamaí Contae i gCorcaigh agus i mBaile Átha Cliath tá Sirriamí Ioncaim a chuireann fiacha atá dlite do na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim i bhfeidhm
They have the power to collect tax debts
Tá an chumhacht acu fiacha cánach a bhailiú

They can do this on the basis of a certificate of liability issued by the Collector General (the official in the Revenue Commissioners who is responsible for collecting taxes) and do not need a court order
Is féidir leo é seo a dhéanamh trí theastas fiachais eisithe ag an Ard-Bhailitheoir (an t-oifigeach sna Coimisinéirí Ioncaim atá freagrach as bailiú cánacha) agus ní gá ordú cúirte a bheith acu
Revenue debts can also be collected in the normal way if there is a court order
Is féidir fiacha ioncaim a bhailiú freisin ar an ngnáthbhealach má tá ordú cúirte ann
The Sheriff or County Registrar does not have to give notice of intention to seize your property or goods in order to execute a judgment
Ní chaithfidh an Sirriam nó an Cláraitheoir Contae fógra a thabhairt go bhfuiltear chun do mhaoin nó do chuid earraí a urghabháil chun breithiúnas a fhorghníomhú
Their duty is to the creditor, so they cannot take your circumstances into account
Luíonn dualgas an tSirriam/Chláraitheoir a Contae leis an gcreidiúnaí agus ní féidir leo do chúinsí a thógáil san áireamh
Revenue Sheriffs have specific powers to make an instalment arrangement with you
Tá cumhachtaí sonracha ag Sirriam Ioncaim socrú tráthchoda a dhéanamh leat
The creditor may apply to court to have you examined about your assets so that it can be established what assets you have that are available for the execution of the judgment

Féadfaidh an creidiúnaí iarratas a dhéanamh ar an gcúirt scrúdú a dhéanamh ort i leith do shócmhainní ionas gur féidir a bhunú céard iad na sócmhainní atá agat atá ar fáil le haghaidh fheidhmiú an bhreithiúnais
The Sheriff/County Registrar has the power to go onto your property in order to seize your goods
Tá an chumhacht ag Sirriamaí/Cláraitheoirí Contae dul ar do réadmhaoin chun do chuid earraí a ghabháil
They must make reasonable efforts to do this peaceably and without violence but they may make a forced entry
Caithfidh siad iarrachtaí réasúnta a dhéanamh é seo a dhéanamh go síochánta gan fhoréigean ach is féidir leo iontráil go fórsúil
The law provides that the Sheriff/County Registrar may not seize certain goods but this is effectively meaningless because of the amounts allowed
Forálann an dlí nach féidir le Sirriamaí/Cláraitheoirí Contae earraí áirithe a ghabháil ach tá sé seo gan bhrí éifeachtach mar gheall ar na méideanna a cheadaítear
They may not seize your necessary clothes and bedding and the tools of your trade provided the value of such necessities is not more than €19
Ní féidir leo do chuid éadaí agus leabú riachtanacha a ghabháil ná uirlisí do thrádála ar choinníoll nach bhfuil luach na n-earraí riachtanacha seo níos mó ná €19
In practice, goods with a low resale value are unlikely to be seized
I gcleachtas, ní dócha go ngabhtar earraí le luach athdhíolta íseal
The Sheriff/County Registrar must account to the court for the goods seized
Caithfidh na Sirriamaí/CláraitheoiríContae cuntas a thabhairt don chúirt a shainmhíníonn na hearraí gabhta
If no goods are found, they make a return of nulla bona, literally meaning "no goods"
Más rud é nach bhfaightear earra ar bith, déanann siad 'nulla bona' a aischur, a chiallaíonn, go litriúil, earraí ar bith
If the Sheriff/County Registrar does seize your goods, they must, within 24 hours, give you an itemised and signed list of the goods seized
Má dhéanann Sirriamaí/CláraitheoiríContae do chuid earraí a ghabháil, caithfidh siad, laistigh de 24 uair an chloig, liosta mionsonraithe agus sínithe na n-earraí a ghabhadh a thabhairt duit
They may then sell the goods by public auction – this can happen at any time from 2 days after the seizures
Féadfaidh siad na hearraí a dhíol ansin trí cheant poiblí – d’fhéadfadh sé seo tarlú ag am ar bith ó dhá lá tar éis na ngabhálacha
In practice, you are usually given warning of the impending sale
I gcleachtas, tugtar rabhadh duit faoin díolatá i ngar, de ghnáth
The instalment order procedure is mainly used by small creditors such as shops and credit unions
Úsáidtear nós imeachta an ordú tráthchoda go príomha ag creidiúnaithe ar nós siopaí agus comhair chreidmheasa
It can be used for judgments given in the District, Circuit or High Court
Is féidir é a úsáid le haghaidh breithiúnais a tugadh sa Chúirt Dúiche, sa Chúirt Chuarda nó san Ard-Chúirt
It is also used by creditors in family law proceedings, mainly for the enforcement of maintenance orders
Úsáideann creidiúnaithe é freisin in imeachtaí dlí teaghlaigh, go príomha le haghaidh fhorfheidhmiú na n-orduithe cothabhála
If you are a family law debtor - for example, if you have a maintenance order against you which has not been met - your creditor can get an attachment of earnings order
Más creidiúnaí dlí teaghlaigh thú, mar shampla, má tá ordú cothabhála agat i do choinne nach bhfuil comhlíonta go fóill, is féidir do chreidiúnaí ordú um astú tuillimh a fháil
Instalment orders are governed by the Enforcement of Court Orders Acts 1926 - 2009 and Order 53 of the District Court Rules
Tá orduithe tráthchoda faoi rialú ag na hAchtanna um Fheidhmiú Orduithe Cúirte 1926 - 2009 agus ag Ordú 53 de Rialacha na Cúirte Dúiche
Your creditor can apply to the District Court in the district in which you live to have you attend the court in order to establish your means
Is féidir le do chreidiúnaí iarratas a dhéanamh ar an gCúirt Dúiche sa dúiche ina bhfuil cónaí ort ag iarraidh ort freastal ar an gcúirt d’fhonn d'acmhainní a bhunú
The judge may then order payment in full or payment in instalments, taking account of your means
Féadfaidh an breitheamh íocaíocht iomlán nó íocaíocht i dtráthchodanna a ordú, ag tógáil d'acmhainní san áireamh
Failure to meet instalment order
Loiceadh ordú tráthchoda a chomhlíonadh
If you fail to meet the instalment order, the creditor may look for a committal order which would commit you to prison
Má theipeann ort an t-ordú tráthchoda a chomhlíonadh, féadfaidh an creidiúnaí ordú cimithe a lorg a chuirfeadh chun príosúin thú
Upcoming changes: The Civil Debt (Procedures) Act 2015 provides for abolition of the imprisonment of debtors for non-payment of civil debts
Athruithe: Forálann an tAcht um Fhiachas Sibhialta (Nósanna Imeachta), 2015 deireadh a chur le féichiúnaithe a chur i bpriosún
This is due to come into effect shortly
Tá sé le teacht i bhfeidhm go luath
The Enforcement of Court Orders (Amendment) Act 2009 sets out the procedure for committal orders
Leagann an tAcht um Fhorfheidhmiú Orduithe Cúirte (Leasú) 2009 amach an nós imeachta le haghaidh orduithe cimithe
This effectively provides that you may be imprisoned for failure to pay debts only if you can afford to pay but refuse to do so
Soláthraíonn sé seo gur féidir thú a chur i bpríosún má theipeann ort fiacha a íoc sa chás go bhfuil sé d’acmhainn agat íoc astu ach diúltaíonn tú é a dhéanamh
The process involves a summons to appear at the District Court
Baineann toghairm le bheith i láthair ag an gCúirt Dúiche leis an bpróiseas
This is issued by the District Court clerk at the request of the creditor
Tá sé seo eisithe ag an gcléireach Cúirte Dúiche arna iarraidh ag an gcreidiúnaí
The summons must clearly set out:
Caithfidh an toghairm na nithe seo a leanas a leagadh amach go soiléir:
• The consequences of a failure to turn up in court, including the possibility of imprisonment
• na hiarmhairtí a bhaineann le loiceadh a bheith sa chúirt, lena n-áirítear an fhéidearthacht phríosúnachta;
• The options available to the judge at the hearing
• na roghanna atá ar fáil don bhreitheamh ag an éisteacht;
• The possibility that you will be arrested if you fail to turn up in court
• an fhéidearthacht go ngabhfar thú má theipeann ort dul chun na cúirte
You are required to prepare a statement of means and lodge this at least a week before the hearing is due to take place
Iarrtar ort ráiteas acmhainne a ullmhú agus é seo a thaisceadh ar a laghad seachtain roimh chur i gcrích na héisteachta
If you fail to turn up, without reasonable excuse, a judge can either issue an arrest warrant (this orders the Gardaí to bring you before the court at the earliest opportunity) or adjourn the hearing

Má theipeann ort a bheith i láthair, gan leithscéal réasúnta, is féidir le breitheamh barántas gabhála a eisiúint (ordaíonn sé seo na Gardaí thú a thabhairt os comhair na cúirte chomh luath agus is féidir) nó an éisteacht a chur ar athló
If you are arrested and brought to court, a date is fixed for the hearing
Má ghabhtar thú agus má thugtar chun na cúirte thú, socraítear dáta don éisteacht
The judge must make clear to you, in ordinary language:
Ní mór don bhreitheamh a chur in iúl duit go soiléir, i ngnáthchaint,
• That you are entitled to apply for legal aid and
• go bhfuil tú i dteideal iarratas a dhéanamh ar chúnamh dlíthiúil agus
• The consequences, including imprisonment, of failing to comply with the instalment order or of failing to appear for the hearing on the date fixed
• na hiarmhairtí, lena n-áirítear príosúnacht, a bhaineann le loiceadh géilleadh leis an ordú tráthchoda nó loiceadh a bheith i láthair don éisteacht ar an dáta socraithe
At the hearing, both you and the creditor may give evidence
Ag an éisteacht, féadfaidh tú féin agus an creidiúnaí fianaise a thabhairt
The court has a number of options
Tá roinnt roghanna ag an gcúirt
It may vary the instalment order
Féadfaidh sí an t-ordú tráthchoda a athrú
Alternatively, the court may ask you to engage in mediation
Mar mhalairt air sin, féadfaidh an chúirt iarraidh ort dul i mbun idirghabhála
The Money Advice and Budgeting Service (MABS) may be used for such mediation
Is féidir MABS a úsáid le haghaidh idirghabhála den chinéal sin
The third option is to make a committal order (for a maximum of 3 months)
Is é an tríú rogha ordú cimithe a dhéanamh (ar feadh uasmhéid de thrí mhí)
This can come into effect immediately or at a later date
Is féidir leis seo teacht i bhfeidhm láithreach nó ag dáta níos déanaí
A committal order is an order to the Gardaí for your arrest and imprisonment
Is ordú cimithe é ordú chuig na Gardaí thú a ghabháil agus a phríosúnú
The creditor is obliged to establish, beyond reasonable doubt, that you have means but you are wilfully refusing to pay
Tá oibleagáid ar an gcreidiúnaí a bhunú, thar aon amhras réasúnta, go bhfuil acmhainní agat ach go bhfuil tú ag diúltú a íoc go toiliúil
The court has the power to grant you legal aid in accordance with the rules governing the criminal legal aid scheme
Tá an chumhacht ag an gcúirt cúnamh dlíthiúil a bhronnadh ort i gcomhréir leis na rialacha a rialaíonn an scéim um chúnamh dlíthiúil coiriúil
At present, attachment of earnings is used only for orders of maintenance of spouses and children
Faoi láthair, níl astú tuillimh ar fáil ach amháin chun cothabháil a íoc do chéilí agus leanaí
The Civil Debt (Procedures) Act 2015 provides for the attachment of earnings or deductions from social welfare payments, as appropriate, for the purpose of the enforcement of debts
Forálann an tAcht um Fhiachas Sibhialta (Nósanna Imeachta), 2015 go leathnófar scóp an rogha seo
It is due to come into effect shortly
Tá sé le teacht i bhfeidhm go luath
The creditor may register a charge against property owned by you
Is féidir leis an gcreidiúnaí morgáiste breithiúnais a chlárú i do choinne
The effect is the same as taking out a conventional mortgage
Tá an éifeacht chéanna ag morgáiste breithiúnais go forleathan le morgáiste gnásúil
You have to pay off the judgment mortgage when the property is sold
Caithfidh tú í a íoc nuair a dhíolann tú an teach
Read more in our document on home repossession
Faigh tuilleadh eolais inár gcáipéis ar athshealbhú baile
If you owe money to a creditor and another person owes money to you, then your creditor can get an order which attaches the debt owed to you by the other person
Má tá airgead ag dul do chreidiúnaí uait agus tá airgead ag dul duit ó dhuine eile, ansin is féidir le do chreidiúnaí ordú a fháil a cheanglaíonn an fiach atá dlite duit ag an duine eile dó
This is known as a garnishee order
Tugtar ordú gairnisí air seo
Generally, it is used only in cases where there are no goods to be seized to satisfy the judgment
Go ginearálta, úsáidtear é ach amháin nuair nach bhfuil aon earraí le gabhadh chun an breithiúnas a shásamh
It is relatively rarely used in cases of consumer debt
Tá sé sách annamh a úsáidtear é i gcásanna fhiachas tomhaltóra
The Revenue Commissioners have specific powers of attachment which can be exercised without a court order
Tá cumhachtaí astú féich ar leith ag na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim agus is féidir iad a fheidhmiú gan ordú cúirte
A receiver may be appointed over some of your assets or over future income such as rents, income of a trust fund or a pension
Is féidir le glacadóir a bheith ceaptha thar roinnt de do shócmhainní nó thar ioncam sa todhchaí mar chíos, ioncam ó chiste iontaobhais nó pinsean
The law in this area is complex but it seems that a receiver cannot be appointed over future earnings
Tá an dlí sa réimse seo casta ach is cosúil nach féidir le glacadóir a bheith ceaptha thar thuilleamh sa todhchaí
If you are unable to pay your debts, you may petition the High Court to be declared bankrupt
Munar féidir leat do chuid fiacha a íoc, féadfaidh tú an cinneadh a dhéanamh gurb é d’fhéimheacht a dhearbhú an réiteach is fearr duit
Alternatively, your creditor may apply to have you declared bankrupt if certain conditions are met
I gcásannan áirithe, d'fhéadfaidh creidiúnaí achainí a dhéanamh i leith féimheachta
Read more about bankruptcy
Le haghaidh tuilleadh eolais ar fhéimheacht, féach ar ár gcáipéis Cad is féimheacht ann?
